Such red. There's still work ahead of us :-)

@kpayson64 - back to Python failures only on Mac - https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_pull_requests_macos/4500/testReport/junit/(root)/aggregate_tests/run_tests_python_macos_dbg_native/ - is there any way we can up verbosity during build to debug?

@ctiller 
I think I have a good handle on whats causing the build failure on mac
```
error: invalid argument '-std=c++11' not allowed with 'C/ObjC'
```

The problem is I don't have a good quick fix for this one, gcc makes this a warning but it is an error for clang.  It might require breaking the Python build system into separate "build rules" for c/c++.

Are we going to need c++11?  If not, I can just remove the argument, but I would need another ```#ifdef``` to explicitly disable the use of c++ atomics.

I investigated having two separate Python "build targets", but unfortunately the result was two separate .so files, one for c and one for c++, and it looks like there is no way for python to support a static library build target.

I think we will need to completely revamp the Python build system to use Makefiles at this point.  The other option is to just use gcc to build our mac targets.

Ok, let's fail-fast on this for now.
The other other option is to convert everything to C++ and hope for the
best.
